de.esoco.storage

Class StoragePredicates

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.storage.StoragePredicates

  • public class StoragePredicates
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains static factory methods that generate predicates which are specific for storage queries.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  StoragePredicates.GetAttribute<I,A extends org.obrel.core.Relatable>
      An element accessor that uses reflection to query the value of a certain field in target objects.
      static class  StoragePredicates.Like
      A comparison that is equivalent to the SQL LIKE expression which compares string input values to a SQL-specific string pattern.
      static class  StoragePredicates.SortPredicate<T>
      An element predicate that is used to define the ordering of storage queries.

    • Method Detail

      • createWildcardFilter

        public static <T> de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<T> createWildcardFilter(java.lang.String sFilter)
        Creates a wildcard filter predicate for a SQL like expression. The filter string may contain wildcard characters like '*' or '?' (or their SQL equivalents). If the filter string doesn't contain a '*' wildcard one will be appended to the end (to match all values that start with the filter value). Any wildcards in the given filter value will be converted to the corresponding SQL wildcards by means of StorageManager.convertToSqlConstraint(String).
        Parameters:
        sFilter - The original filter value
        Returns:
        The converted filter value

      • forType

        public static <T> QueryPredicate<T> forType(java.lang.Class<T> rType,
                                            de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super T> pCritera)
        Returns a new query predicate for a certain type of storage object.
        Parameters:
        rType - The class of the storage object to query for
        pCritera - A predicate containing the query criteria
        Returns:
        A new instance of QueryPredicate

      • hasChild

        public static <T> de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<T> hasChild(java.lang.Class<T> rChildType,
                                                                de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super T> pChildCritera)
        Returns a new query predicate for queries on child elements in master-detail relationships. This method is a shortcut to create a new instance of QueryPredicate for master-detail queries. It is only intended to be used for (parsed) storage queries and not for direct evaluation.
        Parameters:
        rChildType - The child type to query for
        pChildCritera - The criteria to apply to the child elements
        Returns:
        A new instance of QueryPredicate

      • ifAttribute

        public static <T,A extends org.obrel.core.Relatable> de.esoco.lib.expression.predicate.ElementPredicate<T,java.lang.Object> ifAttribute(StorageMapping<T,A,?> rMapping,
                                                                                                                                        A rAttribute,
                                                                                                                                        de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<java.lang.Object> pValueCriteria)
        Creates a new ElementPredicate for a certain attribute of storage objects. This provides generic access to attributes defined in arbitrary storage mapping but with less type safety than more specific element predicates. If possible applications should prefer such predicates if possible.
        Parameters:
        rMapping - The storage mapping the attribute is defined in
        rAttribute - The attribute to apply the predicate to
        pValueCriteria - The predicate to apply to attribute values
        Returns:
        A new element predicate with the given parameters

      • ifField

        public static <T,V> de.esoco.lib.expression.predicate.ElementPredicate<T,V> ifField(java.lang.String sField,
                                                                                    de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<V> pValueCriteria)
        This method is a just renamed variant of the standard predicate method Predicates.ifField(String, Predicate). It exists only for semantic reasons to provide better readability in the context of storage queries, e.g. query(forType(X, withField(value, equalTo(1)))).
        See Also:
        Predicates.ifField(String, Predicate)

      • like

        public static de.esoco.lib.expression.BinaryPredicate<java.lang.Object,java.lang.String> like(java.lang.String sSqlPattern)
        Returns a predicate that checks whether input strings match the pattern of a certain SQL LIKE expression.
        Parameters:
        sSqlPattern - The SQL LIKE pattern to compare input values with
        Returns:
        A new instance of StoragePredicates.Like

      • refersTo

        public static <T> QueryPredicate<T> refersTo(java.lang.Class<T> rReferencedType,
                                             de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super T> pCritera)
        Returns a new query predicate for sub-queries on referenced objects in relationships between storage objects. This method is a shortcut to create a new instance of QueryPredicate for such queries with the appropriate semantics. It is mainly intended to be used for (parsed) storage queries and not for direct evaluation.
        Parameters:
        rReferencedType - The referenced type to query for
        pCritera - The criteria to apply to the referenced type
        Returns:
        A new instance of QueryPredicate

      • refersTo

        public static <T,V> de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<V> refersTo(java.lang.Class<T> rReferencedType,
                                                                  de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super T,V> fReferencedAttr,
                                                                  de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super T> pCritera)
        Returns a new query predicate for sub-queries on referenced objects in relationships between storage objects. This method is a shortcut to create a new instance of QueryPredicate for such queries with the appropriate semantics. It is intended to be used for (parsed) storage queries and not for direct evaluation.
        Parameters:
        rReferencedType - The referenced type to query for
        fReferencedAttr - A function that defines the referenced attribute
        pCritera - The criteria to apply to the referenced type
        Returns:
        A new instance of QueryPredicate

      • similarTo

        public static de.esoco.lib.expression.BinaryPredicate<java.lang.Object,java.lang.String> similarTo(java.lang.String sValue)
        Returns a predicate that matches if the target attribute is similar to a certain value ("fuzzy" search). The similarity is determined by applying a SQL function. This function is defined from the storage parameters when creating a new storage instance.
        Parameters:
        sValue - The compare value
        Returns:
        A new instance of StoragePredicates.Like

      • sortBy

        public static <T> StoragePredicates.SortPredicate<T> sortBy(java.lang.String sField)
        Creates a new predicate that defines an ascending sort order for a field.
        See Also:
        sortBy(String, boolean)

      • sortBy

        public static <T extends org.obrel.core.Relatable> StoragePredicates.SortPredicate<T> sortBy(org.obrel.core.RelationType<?> rType)
        Creates a new predicate that defines an ascending sort order for a certain relation.
        See Also:
        sortBy(RelationType, boolean)

      • sortBy

        public static <T> StoragePredicates.SortPredicate<T> sortBy(java.lang.String sField,
                                                            boolean bAscending)
        Creates a new predicate that defines a sort order for a certain field. The returned predicate only has a declarative purpose and will therefore always evaluate to TRUE.
        Parameters:
        sField - The name of the field to sort by
        bAscending - TRUE for ascending sort order, FALSE for descending
        Returns:
        A new sort predicate

      • sortBy

        public static <T> StoragePredicates.SortPredicate<T> sortBy(java.lang.String sField,
                                                            de.esoco.lib.property.SortDirection eDirection)
        Creates a new predicate that defines a sort order for a certain field. The returned predicate only has a declarative purpose and will therefore always evaluate to TRUE.
        Parameters:
        sField - The name of the field to sort by
        eDirection - The sort direction
        Returns:
        A new sort predicate

      • sortBy

        public static <T extends org.obrel.core.Relatable> StoragePredicates.SortPredicate<T> sortBy(org.obrel.core.RelationType<?> rType,
                                                                                             boolean bAscending)
        Creates a new predicate that defines a sort order for a certain property that is defined by a relation type. The returned predicate only has a declarative purpose and will therefore always evaluate to TRUE.
        Parameters:
        rType - The type of the property to sort by
        bAscending - TRUE for ascending sort order, FALSE for descending
        Returns:
        A new sort predicate

      • sortBy

        public static <T extends org.obrel.core.Relatable> StoragePredicates.SortPredicate<T> sortBy(org.obrel.core.RelationType<?> rType,
                                                                                             de.esoco.lib.property.SortDirection eDirection)
        Creates a new predicate that defines a sort order for a certain property that is defined by a relation type. The returned predicate only has a declarative purpose and will therefore always evaluate to TRUE.
        Parameters:
        rType - The type of the property to sort by
        eDirection - The sort direction
        Returns:
